Title.evidence: A Randomised Controlled Trial of Minimally Invasive Surgery for Intracerebral Hemorrhage

Trial_Design.evidence: This Phase III randomised controlled trial involved 242 participants in the surgical arm of the MISTIE trial

Participants.evidence: Eligible participants were adults with supratentorial ICH

Intervention.evidence: The intervention was minimally invasive surgery, compared to standard care

Objective.evidence: This study assesses surgical performance and its impact on intracerebral hemorrhage (ICH) evacuation and functional outcomes

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the modified Rankin Scale (mRS) score of 0 to 3 at 1 year

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated with allocation concealment

Number_Randomised.evidence: This Phase III randomised controlled trial involved 242 participants in the surgical arm of the MISTIE trial

Number_Analysed.evidence: Analysis was conducted on an intention-to-treat basis

Result_Outcome.evidence: Greater ICH reduction was associated with a higher likelihood of achieving mRS 0 to 3
